data.text: Welcome to Emerald Woods! You can dismiss these tips any time from the System menu. If this is your first time it's heavily recommended to follow them.
Use the arrow keys, WASD, or the numpad to move around.
data.mobileText: Use the left directional pad move around.

data.text: The white square next to your character represents the direction you are facing and the tile you have in front.
You can use [Shift]+direction to point and turn without moving. Try it now!
data.mobileText: Before moving into a direction, you will need to "face" in that direction. Try it now!

data.text: Now let's look into some facilities for agile action, try bumping into a tree while there is an axe in your inventory.
Note how the axe has been selected! Press $ACTION to use it.
Continue hitting the tree until it's fell, using $ACTION while the axe is selected and you are facing the tree.
Some times you will need to use an action other than the default $ACTION one. Press $ACTIONS to see a complete contextual actions menu at any time!
This menu lists all possible current actions, as well as the "View Activities" option which you can use at any time, if you don't know what to do next.
Some tasks, like tilling the ground, require you to manually select the tool. Close the actions menu with $CLOSE and use $CHANGE_TOOL to select the Hoe.
With the hoe selected, face a clean grass tile, and press $ACTION. Note that you might need to clean the tile using a machete or a shovel.
Now, select the carrot seeds from your inventory. You can use $CHANGE_TOOL_UP to select in the opposite direction.
Now face tilled soil, and press $ACTION while carrot seeds are selected, to plant a seed.
Great! the carrot will take some days to grow, however, you will need to protect your crops against hungry animals!
Let's gather 10 wood to build some fences. Bump into the trees and press $ACTION. Once the tree is down, press $ACTION again while facing the fell wood to gather it.
Now press $BUILD to enter Building mode.
While in Building mode, browse to the wooden fence and press $ACTION to select it.
While in Building mode, browse to the wooden fence and press $ACTION to select it.
With the wooden fence selected, move around the map and face a free tile, then press $ACTION to build a fence section.
Connect that fence section with some others to protect your crops. The materials used will be the ones in your inventory plus any others you have laying around.
Build another fence section.
We'll finish the fence later, let's brew some coffee. Press $CLOSE to go to exploration mode, pick up the steel pot in the ruined cabin and fill it with water
Campfires provide safe spaces to sleep, and also allow you to cook food. Switch to building mode with $BUILD and build a campfire from the tools menu.
While in Exploration mode, place the pot filled with water on top of the campfire using $ACTION when facing it while the "Water" is selected.
Now face the campfire and press $ACTION to enter cooking mode.
Brew some coffee to continue.
Campfires, like most things in the world, can be destroyed. If you need to recover critical materials, such as the Flintstone, you could chop down the campfire using an axe.
For now, however, it may make sense to keep this campfire as you will soon need a safe, warm place to pass the night. If you sleep under 15ÂºC your health will suffer and you may eventually die!
Gather some more wood for future constructions and, whenever your fatigue bar is filling up, walk back next to the campfire and select the Sleep action from the $ACTIONS menu.
data.mobileText: Gather some more wood and, whenever your fatigue bar is filling up, walk back next to the campfire and select "Sleep" from the $ACTIONS menu.

data.text: Note that you can also rest in place using the central button of your directional pad, this can be done a limited number of times during the day. Consuming certain items may also recover your fatigue.
At the back of the cabin ruins, there's a shed with several useful tools. It's your choice to get them from there, or explore the land to find them in the abandoned "Stations".
Near the cabin, to the West, there's a hatch leading to an underground station. Pick the map you will find there.
Examine the map to get an idea of what is close by.
Remember, you will need food to survive. Either plan ahead a farm of carrots, or procure a knife to be able to sacrifice animals to eat their meat.
Explore the woods and caverns around to find animals and forage food.
Big animals cannot be picked up; if you happen to find one, you'll need a Leash to bring him to your farm.
Make sure to feed him with Knock nuts, before attempting to leash it.
You just harvested a crop! You can obtain seeds from it. Select the crop and press $ACTIONS to mash it.
Most of the time, just eating the fruit will also yield the seeds, but some recipes require mashed fruit.
On your next game, you can toggle these tips on and off from the System Menu. Have fun!
You got a skillet! Place it on top of a cooking place to fry ingredients into delicious recipes!
You fetch your laptop. You can use it to play games and other creative affairs.
You got the key of the Central Station!
You got a knife! You can use it to kill animals for their meat.
You got a leash! Use it to capture animals and pull them along with you!
You got a shovel! Dig the ground to obtain clay or make holes and channels.
You got a pickax! Use it to mine mountains for minerals and make passageways.
You got a steel pot! Place it on top of a cooking place to boil ingredients into delicious recipes!
